value:
A gift from the Gatekeeper. It's a helm
common to Garreg Mach Monastery
guards. Wearers are extra courteous!

A gift from the Gatekeeper. It's a helm
common to Garreg Mach Monastery
guards. There's a cat on it!

An extremely rare fish from Marianne.
This ancient fish swam in the waters
of Fódlan for countless generations.

An extremely rare fish from Marianne.
Its beauty is such that legends say
it is a messenger from the goddess.

A distinctive accessory from Marth.
It projects a king's majesty with its
shining red jewel.

A distinctive accessory from Marth.
Its antique design is a relic of Altea's
storied past.

An elegant helm from Eirika. It exudes
a brilliant presence due to its shine,
though it is lacking in coverage.

An elegant helm from Eirika. The tuft
at its top grants it a stylish air that is
simply beyond description.

Finish all turns to complete a game of Pawns
of Loki.

Clear the Bound Hero Battle against Tanya
& Osian with Sharena: Princess of Askr on
your team.

With Alfonse: Prince of Askr on your team,
clear the Bound Hero Battle against Tanya
& Osian on Lunatic or higher difficulty.

Defeat Tanya at level 40 or higher with
Sharena: Princess of Askr.

Defeat Osian at level 40 or higher with
Alfonse: Prince of Askr.

Clear the Bound Hero Battle against Tanya
& Osian on Lunatic or higher difficulty using
an all-infantry team.

Defeat a foe with the My Summoner unit
in Mjölnir's Strike.

Defeat a foe with the My Summoner unit
in Mjölnir's Strike.

Clear Book V, Chapter 10: Part 1 on Lunatic
difficulty with a lance ally on your team. (Allies
deployed as cohorts using Pair Up do not
count.) All four allies must survive.

Clear Book V, Chapter 10: Part 2 on Lunatic
difficulty with an axe ally on your team. (Allies
deployed as cohorts using Pair Up do not
count.) All four allies must survive.

Clear Book V, Chapter 10: Part 3 on Lunatic
difficulty with a sword ally on your team. (Allies
deployed as cohorts using Pair Up do not
count.) All four allies must survive.

Clear Book V, Chapter 10: Part 4 on Lunatic
difficulty with a lance ally on your team. (Allies
deployed as cohorts using Pair Up do not
count.) All four allies must survive.

Clear Book V, Chapter 10: Part 5 on Lunatic
difficulty with an axe ally on your team. (Allies
deployed as cohorts using Pair Up do not
count.) All four allies must survive.

The guard who watches over the gates of
Garreg Mach Monastery. A kind man who cares
deeply for all Heroes who pass through his
gate. Appears in Fire Emblem: Three Houses.

Prince of Altea destined to be revered as the
Hero-King, having done countless deeds for the
good of those who came after him. Appears in
Fire Emblem: Mystery of the Emblem.

Adopted daughter of Margrave Edmund. She
can often be found speaking with animals or
praying to the goddess. Appears in Fire
Emblem: Three Houses.

Princess of Renais. She has taken up her
brother's lance so she can defend their
kingdom's future. Appears in Fire Emblem:
The Sacred Stones.

The prince of Daein left behind by the late Mad
King Ashnard. To rebuild Daein, he joins with
Micaiah and involves himself in the struggle.
Appears in Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn.
Kusakihara Toshiyuki (草木原俊行) / INTELLIGENT SYSTEMS

Obstruct the foe's advance and block
warping within 4 spaces! Fortify your
forces by boosting allies' stats.

Boosts allies with his Special, and can
regain HP after combat and attack
before he can be countered.

Grants nearby allies another action
with her Special! Her combat prowess
helps her withstand counterattacks.

Crushes armored and cavalry units!
She can restore health with her
Special and use the Canto effect.

Accelerates Special trigger (cooldown count-1).
Effective against dragon foes. If unit initiates
combat or is within 2 spaces of an ally, grants
Atk/Spd/Def/Res+5 during combat, and also
grants effects based on the total value of
bonuses on the 3 allies with the highest
bonus totals:
If ≥ 10, neutralizes effects that guarantee foe's
follow-up attacks and effects that prevent
unit's follow-up attacks during combat. If ≥ 25,
grants an additional Atk+5 during combat, and
also, if unit deals damage to foe during combat,
restores 5 HP to unit. (Triggers even if 0
damage is dealt.) If ≥ 60, if foe initiates combat,
unit can counterattack before foe's first attack.

Accelerates Special trigger (cooldown count-1).
Effective against armored and cavalry foes.
At start of combat, if unit's HP ≥ 25%, grants
Atk/Spd/Def/Res+5 during combat, reduces
damage from foe's first attack by 30%, and
also, if unit initiates combat, neutralizes effects
that prevent unit's follow-up attacks.

Grants Def+3. Grants Atk/Spd+5 to allies
within 3 rows or 3 columns centered on unit
during combat. Grants effects to unit during
combat based on the number of allies within
3 rows or 3 columns centered on unit:
If ≥ 1 ally, inflicts Atk/Res-X on foe during
combat (X = number of allies in the area × 2;
max -6). If ≥ 3 allies, foe cannot make a
follow-up attack. (If unit is within 2 spaces of a
structure that a foe can destroy, the number of
allies in the area is treated as 3.)

Grants Spd+3. At start of combat, if foe's HP
≥ 50%, inflicts Spd/Res-6 and neutralizes
foe's bonuses to Spd/Res (from skills like
Fortify, Rally, etc.) during combat, and also,
if unit initiates combat, reduces damage from
foe's first attack by 70%.

At start of turn, if unit is within 2 spaces of
an ally, grants unit Atk/Spd/Def/Res+6 for
1 turn and grants allies within 2 spaces of
unit Atk+6 for 1 turn. Boosts Special damage
by 35% of unit's Spd. After combat, if unit's
Special triggered, grants Atk/Spd/Def/Res+6
to unit and all allies for 1 turn. (Bonus granted
to allies even if unit's HP reaches 0.)

If unit initiates combat, after combat, grants
another action to ally with the highest HP
within 2 spaces (excluding unit) that has
already acted. (Once per turn.) (Allies with
Sing or Dance can be granted this effect as
well. If multiple units meet the conditions,
effect will not trigger.) If an ally is granted
an additional action this way, inflicts "restricts
movement to 1 space" on that ally (and their
Pair Up cohort).

If unit initiates combat, grants Atk/Spd+7
to unit during combat, and also, if unit deals
damage to foe using a Special, restores HP
= X% of unit's max HP (X = unit's max Special
cooldown count value × 20, + 10; max 100).
(Triggers even if 0 damage is dealt.)

If foe initiates combat, grants Def+5 to unit
during combat and unit can counterattack
regardless of foe's range.

Unit can counterattack regardless of foe's range.
At start of combat, if unit's HP ≥ 25%, grants
Spd+5 during combat, but after combat, if unit
attacked, deals 5 damage to unit.

If unit is within 2 spaces of an ally, grants
Atk/Spd+5 to unit during combat, and also,
if unit is inflicted with any Atk/Spd penalty,
grants bonus to unit's Atk/Spd during combat
= current penalty on each of those stats × 2.
(Example: if unit has -7 penalty to Atk, grants
Atk+14, for a net bonus of Atk+12.) Calculates
each stat bonus independently.

$aEnables【Canto (２)】.

Neutralizes unit's penalties that inflict "Special
cooldown charge -X" on unit during combat.
Deals damage = X% of foe's Def when Special
triggers (X = unit's max Special cooldown
count value × 10, + 20).

【Canto (２)】
After an attack, Assist skill, or structure
destruction, unit can move ２ space(s).

(Unit moves according to movement type. Once
per turn. Cannot attack or assist. Only highest
value applied. Does not stack. After moving,
if a skill that grants another action would be
triggered (like with Galeforce), Canto will
trigger after the granted action. Unit's base
movement has no effect on movement granted.
Cannot warp (using skills like Wings of Mercy)
a distance greater than ２ space(s).)

Foes with Range = 1 cannot move through
spaces adjacent to unit. (Does not affect foes
with Pass skills.)

Foes with Range = 2 cannot move through
spaces within 2 spaces of unit. (Does not
affect foes with Pass skills.)

Foes cannot warp into spaces within 4 spaces
of unit. (Does not affect foes with Pass skills or
warp effects from structures, like camps and
fortresses in Rival Domains.)

Grants Def+4 to allies within 2 spaces during
combat. If unit is within 2 spaces of an ally,
grants Def+4 to unit during combat.

Crimea, able to put up only a meager
resistance, was destroyed by Daein
when its king, Ashnard, launched an
assault. Princess Elincia, whose very
existence had been kept a secret, fled
to a friendly nearby country. In the
midst of her journey, she met the
Greil Mercenaries—and Ike, the son
of their leader...

Envoys from Begnion, including the
empress, Apostle Sanaki, were en
route to visit the princess when their
ship came under attack by pirates.
Learning of the attack, Ike sought to
rescue them, only to find that Sanaki
had disappeared in the chaos of the
fighting. When Ike finally found her,
he was surprised to learn how
young she was, given her station...

Ike and the mercenaries were then
summoned to the imperial capital.
Begnion had a long history of
enslaving and exploiting the laguz,
and even though such practices had
been officially outlawed, there were
still those who trafficked laguz.
Sanaki arranged a meeting between
the slavers, those who sought
emancipation, and Ike...

Sanaki had been targeting the slaver
ringleader, seeking to expose the
corruption of the Begnion nobility.
Sure enough, Ike found and rescued
the heron laguz prince who had long
been thought lost. Sanaki, shocked to
learn of his survival, explained the
story of the Serenes Massacre of
20 years prior...

Enraged over the assassination of the
previous Apostle and believing the
herons responsible, the Begnion
people had set the herons' home of
Serenes Forest ablaze. But the truth
was, the herons had been framed.
Sanaki knelt before the prince in her
people's stead and apologized for
their past trespasses...

The prince accepted Sanaki's apology
and used the Galdr of Rebirth to
restore the herons' home. Ike, having
forged a new bond between beorc
and laguz, impressed Begnion with
his efforts, earning their pledge of
support for the princess of Crimea.
The mercenaries then prepared to
enter a new battle, this time as the
Crimean Liberation Army.
